title.narrative: Support to the plan “borde fluvial Valdivia” through organizing five digital workshops

description.narrative: The master plan “borde fluvial Valdivia” is a complete re-structuring of the borders of the river Valdivia, the only navigable river in Chile. The master plan’s main objective is recovery of the space(s) along the river edges of the navigable rivers of the city of Valdivia for citizen’s use, with a local identity and a sustainable vision for the future. With citizen’s use one refers to accessibility, public transport and urban use of river spaces. Historic value, landscape and environment are essential with regard to local identity as well as social value. Sustainability of the master plan is measured along the Sustainable Development Goals of the UN (2030).Earlier this year, Royal HaskoningDHV (RHDHV) has presented the project called “Ruimte voor de Waal – Dijkverlegging Lent/ Nijmegen” twice, to inspire the Chilean actors involved in the development of plan “Borde fluvial Valdivia”. The project in Nijmegen shows some important similarities with the Valdivia plan, reason for the interest of Valdivia in the particular project. The presentations triggered an additional request to share more lessons learned through a series of workshops focused on 5 different topics identified by the Chilean counterparts (and communicated through the Ministry of Public Works). The topics discussed were: 1) an introduction to nature-based solutions, 2) the implementation of nature-based solutions, 3) governance for large integrated water sector projects/ programs, 4) the design and implementation of a rowing track, and 5) stakeholder management/ participation processes.This assignment is financed through the Partners for Water Program, executed by the Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO), part of the Netherlands Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate. The Partners for Water Program is commissioned by the Ministry of Infrastructure and Water Management on behalf of the Interdepartmental Water Cluster. Chilean partners included the Ministerio de Obras Públicas, Secretaría Regional Ministerial, Dirección Regional de Planeamiento, Dirección Regional de Obras Portuarias, Dirección de Arquitectura, Dirección Regional de Aguas, Dirección Regional de Obras Hidráulicas, Secretaría de Planificación, División de Infraestructura, Corporación PEC, Activa Valdivia, Universidad Austral de Chile, Federación de Remo de Chile, and Secretaría Reg. Ministerial e Instituto Nacional del Deporte. In addition, to the workshop, a recap was made to learn from the workshops and identify opportunities for the Dutch Water Sector to support further development of the masterplan. All workshops were recorded and can be viewed on YouTube.
